metadata.name: AWS ElastiCache Security Group Created
metadata.comment: Detects when an ElastiCache security group has been created.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('elasticache.amazonaws.com') AND lower(metadata.event_code) = lower('createcachesecuritygroup'))

output.summary: Detects when an ElastiCache security group has been created.

metadata.objective: False positive: A ElastiCache security group may be created by a system or network administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. Security group creations from unfamiliar users or hosts should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. Reference: https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules/blob/598f3d7e0a63221c0703ad9a0ea7e22e7bc5961e/rules/integrations/aws/persistence_elasticache_security_group_creation.toml
